page.title: 02FARMING SHEEP COWS GOATS.
page.content: MOST OF THE FARMS IN OUR AREA ARE DAIRY FARMS.ALOT OF THE LAND IS USED FOR PASTURE.THE MILK IS COLLECTED AND IS TAKEN TO WHITLAND CREAMERIES.THE AVERAGE FARM IS ABOUT FIFTY ACRES.IN THE SUMMER FARMERS CUT GRASS FOR SILAGE AND HAY TO FEED THE ANIMALS IN THE WINTER.THE FARMERS SHEAR THIER IN THE SUMMER AND THEY BRING THE FLEECE TO THE CARPARK IN NARBERTH TO BE TAKEN TO BRECON.THEY ALSO DIP THEIR SHEEP TWICE A YEAR. THE FARMERS GROW CORN AND CUT IT FOR THE ANIMALS TO FEED ON IN THE WINTER.IN SUMMER THERE ARE TWO GOAT SHOWS IN NARBERTH MARKET GROUND.
